GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves the specific article associated with id parameter

exampleResponse.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
exampleResponse.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: serves an array of all comments asscociated with article id paramater

exampleResponse.author: butter_bridge
exampleResponse.body: I am 100% sure that we're not completely sure.

exampleResponse.author: icellusedkars
exampleResponse.body: What do you see? I have no idea where this will lead us. This place I speak of, is known as the Black Lodge.

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: takes an object with body and author properties and adds a new comment at given article id returning the new object

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: takes an object with property inc_votes and increments the votes at given article id returning the updated object

CORE: DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: deletes the comment located at the specified comment_id responds with no content
